channel.title: MedSchool Podcast :
channel.description: These podcasts are a mix of audio and video material crossing a range of medical and surgical topics. They are designed to improve your understanding and help revise for coming exams.

image.itunes:author: Interactive Podcasting
image.itunes:subtitle: These podcasts are a mix of audio and video material crossing a range of medical and surgical topics. They are designed to improve your understanding and help revise for coming exams.
image.itunes:summary: These podcasts are a mix of audio and video material crossing a range of medical and surgical topics. They are designed to improve your understanding and help revise for coming exams.

item.title: Thyroid Examination
item.description: In this video we demonstrate how to examine the thyroid in patients seen on the ward and in clinic at a level appropriate for final year medical students. We look at eye signs and discuss the differentials of neck swelling.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this video we demonstrate how to examine the thyroid in patients seen on the ward and in clinic at a level appropriate for final year medical students. We look at eye signs and discuss the differentials of neck swelling.
item.itunes:summary: In this video we demonstrate how to examine the thyroid in patients seen on the ward and in clinic at a level appropriate for final year medical students. We look at eye signs and discuss the differentials of neck swelling.

item.title: Haemorrhoids
item.description: In this podcast Miss. Gill Tierney and Mr. Jon Lund discuss aspects of haemorrhoids including presentation, pathogenesis and management options.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this podcast Miss. Gill Tierney and Mr. Jon Lund discuss aspects of haemorrhoids including presentation, pathogenesis and management options.
item.itunes:summary: In this podcast Miss. Gill Tierney and Mr. Jon Lund discuss aspects of haemorrhoids including presentation, pathogenesis and management options.

item.title: Hernia Examination
item.description: In this examination video we look at the assessment of hernias and the groin, briefly looking at hydroceles. We will also review the relevant surface anatomy, a common question in OSCEs and exams. The examination is performed by Miss. Tierney, Colorectal consultant in Derby.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this examination video we look at the assessment of hernias and the groin, briefly looking at hydroceles. We will also review the relevant surface anatomy, a common question in OSCEs and exams. The examination is performed by Miss. Tierney, Colorectal
item.itunes:summary: In this examination video we look at the assessment of hernias and the groin, briefly looking at hydroceles. We will also review the relevant surface anatomy, a common question in OSCEs and exams. The examination is performed by Miss. Tierney, Colorectal consultant in Derby.

item.title: Abdominal Examination
item.description: In this examination video we look at the sequence of clinical abdominal assessment. The patient is assessed by Mr. Lund, Colorectal consultant in Derby.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this examination video we look at the sequence of clinical abdominal assessment. The patient is assessed by Mr. Lund, Colorectal consultant in Derby.
item.itunes:summary: In this examination video we look at the sequence of clinical abdominal assessment. The patient is assessed by Mr. Lund, Colorectal consultant in Derby.

item.title: Diverticular Disease
item.description: In this session Mr. Lund and Mr. Speake discuss diverticular disease. It covers the presentation, etiology, examination findings and treatment of this common condition.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this session Mr. Lund and Mr. Speake discuss diverticular disease. It covers the presentation, etiology, examination findings and treatment of this common condition.
item.itunes:summary: In this session Mr. Lund and Mr. Speake discuss diverticular disease. It covers the presentation, etiology, examination findings and treatment of this common condition.

item.title: Breast Disease and Examination (ECS)
item.description: In this lecture we give a summary of the diseases it is important for early clinical students to look at before exams. We also go through the full clinical examination of the breast.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this lecture we give a summary of the diseases it is important for early clinical students to look at before exams. We also go through the full clinical examination of the breast.
item.itunes:summary: In this lecture we give a summary of the diseases it is important for early clinical students to look at before exams. We also go through the full clinical examination of the breast.

item.title: Endocrine Disease (ECS)
item.description: In this session we concentrate on the presentation, management and examination of patients with thyroid disease and diabetes. We draw on the experience of guest lecturer Dr. Anand Velusamy, SpR in endocrine disease.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this session we concentrate on the presentation, management and examination of patients with thyroid disease and diabetes. We draw on the experience of guest lecturer Dr. Anand Velusamy, SpR in endocrine disease.
item.itunes:summary: In this session we concentrate on the presentation, management and examination of patients with thyroid disease and diabetes. We draw on the experience of guest lecturer Dr. Anand Velusamy, SpR in endocrine disease.

item.title: Neurology for Early Clinical Students (ECS)
item.description: This lecture is targeted at early clinical students beginning on their first attachments. In it we l ook at basic neuroanatomy as related to examination of both the cranial nerves and the peripheral nervous system. The sequence of examination we describe here will be useful to all medical students however.

item.title: Examination of the Knee and Spine
item.description: In this follow up lecture we look at the examination of three specific joints again using the Apley system. The joints we focus on are Knee, Ankle and Spine. Remember that by using the Apley system described in the previous lecture you should be able to examine any joint with no problems.

item.title: Interpreting Blood Tests and ABGs
item.description: In this lecture we look at how to interpret the common blood tests seen both in exams and next year on the wards. We also cover the important topic of ABGs.

item.title: Orthopaedic Examination
item.description: This lecture teaches the basics of the Apley system of orthopaedic examination. It is a good basis on which to build all your joint examinations, based around the axiom of “Look, Feel, Move”.

item.title: Head and Neck Examination
item.description: In this follow up lecture to the session on thyroid disease given on the 5/10 we look at how to examine the thyroid and the parotid in the OSCE.

item.title: Vascular Examination
item.description: This lecture teaches the vascular examination for the 5th year OSCE.

item.title: Groin Examination
item.description: This lecture looks at the examination of the groin. It explains the relevant anatomy of the major pathologies seen in exams and the full examination procedure.

item.title: ECGs
item.description: A look at how to interpret ECGs and then a series of examples which commonly are seen in exams and in clinical practice.

item.title: Radiology for OSCEs
item.description: This lecture is looking at the methods you need to use for radiology OSCE stations. There are a number of chest abdominal and contrast films which are explained.

item.title: Thyroid Disease
item.description: In this lecture we look at the principles of thyroid disease including its diagnosis and investigation options. There is then a look at the examination of the thyroid OSCE style with some additional comment on other major head and neck examination.

item.title: Pancreatitis
item.description: Pancreatitis and instructions on how to perform the abdominal examination in OSCEs.
